comments.body: it seems weird that you have to specify this interface.  What else would you generate a deep copy for?

Every (api) type gets a DeepCopy func, but we have runtime.Objects and selectors which are used in a polymorphic way. I.e. you get a runtime.Object without knowing which type it really is. For top-level API objects we create an additional type-independent `DeepCopyObject() runtime.Object` method. My original proposal was adding these automatically for those types embedding `TypeMeta` (compare https://github.com/kubernetes/gengo/pull/44). It was decided by @thockin and @smarterclayton that this was too much magic. So we have these annotations now which trigger the creation of `DeepCopyObject() runtime.Object` explicitly.

> It was decided by @thockin  and @smarterclayton that this was too much magic. So we have these annotations now which trigger the creation of DeepCopyObject() runtime.Object explicitly.

Weird.  Seems like a switch that we'll only throw one way.
